p: PI and/or resin are found in different sections of the stems, branches, roots, leaves and flowers. On average, there are 8% of P and 10% of resin in the plant (dry weight of wild shrub, older than 24 months). For Lloyd and Jasso de Rodriguez, two thirds of the PI are in the stems and branches, and one third in the roots. The leaves contain little or none PI [ 13, 35, 36]. Stem has 6.1% resin followed by roots (5.9%), branches (5.0%), leaves (3.0%), and flowers (3.1%) (dry weight of each part) [ 37].
